args:
Farren and Grace decide to infiltrate another
Syndicate base. But when they stop in a village
on the way and find it under Syndicate control,
Farren becomes enraged and faces off against
soldiers who share his power.
You have all done well to make it here to\nthe Halidom. We'll get rooms ready for\nyou right away so you can rest.
You put so much of yourself into getting\nus here safely, Farren.
Um, Grace? I think I'm going to go\nlook for Aldred.
I understand your feelings, but if he fell\nfrom that cliff without his wyrmbinding\npowers, his end is all but assured.
But there could be a chance!
If Aldred survived that fall, he won't need\nus to come save him. That's just the type\nof person he is.
Did Aldred ask you to rescue him, Farren?\nOr did he ask you to help others?
Do you even know where I'm going?
You're headed for that Syndicate base\nyou've been looking into recently, right?

You know there is no need for you to force
yourself to fight the Syndicate merely
because you were caught up in their
machinations, yes?
I know, but I want to do this. I mean,\nit's what Aldred would have done, right?
All right. But you have to obey my\ninstructions to the letter. Understood?
Well, this is discouraging... I truly thought\nwe would reach the base today.
Aw, you couldn't have known the road\nwould be out because of a landslide.\nBut hey, at least we found this village!
Place is a real craphole, but any kind of\nsoft bed and hot food beats another night\ncamping in the woods.
Lil' Barb... Don't just call this place a\ncraphole in front of the villagers.
Oh my! Travelers? We so rarely get guests\nin our humble little burg!
Apologies, but we have lost our way.\nIf we can but stay the night, we will be\noff at first light tomorrow.

Oh, you're more than welcome, my lady!
In fact, your stories from the road will
prove a welcome respite from the usual
humdrum days we pass here.
You mean Lil' Barb? What about him?
Forgive me, young sir. It's just that\ndragons are rather a rare sight in a\nvillage as small as ours.
Now then, let me show you to the inn.
Something about this is not right.
This whole place is...off somehow. Also,\nthat villager seemed to be familiar with\nLil' Barb in some form or fashion.
Me? But I ain't never been to this craphole\nin my life!
Well, perhaps not you specifically.\nBut I suspect they are familiar with\nBarbatos B-Units in general.

The Wyrmbound Soldier Project is
premised upon the idea of mass
production, which means there are
multiple Barbatos B-Units.
But if the villager knows someone who\nlooks just like Lil' Barb, that means...
It means they know about the Syndicate?
I fear something far worse—I think it\nhighly possible that this entire village\nis currently under Syndicate control.
But they all seem so nice!
Yes, and I'm certain they are—but good\nand kind people can also be your enemy.\nYou would do well to remember this.
In any event, I think we should have\nourselves a little look around.
Without a doubt, sir! The dragon was the\nsame as the ones all of you have!
Excellent. Now capture the traitors\nand bring them to me.
But sir, don't they have terrible power?
Not nearly so terrible as ours. I imagine\nyou can take them with only a moderate\nloss of life.
Predictable. We need to get out of this\ntown before they realize we're gone.
Um, Grace? It seems like those villagers\nare being forced to obey the Syndicate.
That was my impression as well.
Which means they're going to be punished\nif they fail to capture us, right?
If you want to save those people, the best\nway to do so is by skirting trouble here\nand hurrying to the Syndicate base.
*sigh* I can see this conversation is going\nnowhere. Very well—we'll go back.
Wait, really? I thought you'd tell me to\nstop being soft, or that we have to think\nof the many over the few or...whatever.
You mistake me for an ally of justice.\nMy fight against the Syndicate is personal.
I'm fighting to satisfy my own need.\nSo I don't intend to force you to do\notherwise.

But first, we need to take a wait-and-see
approach. If it looks like there's no harm
coming to the villagers, we'll just
quietly leave the village. All right?
Stop, I beg you... All of your violence can\ndo nothing to change the situation...
Silence! You let the traitors slip through\nyour fingers, and for that you must pay!

Easy, Farren. There are more soldiers than
we predicted, and we'll only put people
in further danger if we blunder in there
without a plan.
Grace, is there anything good about\nthe Syndicate?
I just don't understand why people obey an\norganization that does such cruel things.
Ah. Well, the general belief of the\nSyndicate is that this world is in error.
And that there is another world out there—\na ＂correct＂ world—where all people live\nin perfect happiness.
The Syndicate believe that if all people\nfollow the orders of their leader, this world\ncan be reformed—corrected, essentially.
Sounds like a load of hullabaloo to me.\nPeople really believe that codswallop?
Many want to, yes. After all, we have all\nexperienced pain and suffering and\ninjustice in one fashion or another.
The Syndicate offers sympathy and\nvalidation. They tell you that it's not your\nfault. That it's the world that's wrong.
It is an easy and seductive notion.\nJust do what the leader says and someday\nyou'll reach a better world.
I dunno. To me it feels like giving up.
And you are not wrong. But alas, many\npeople are not so strong as to realize that.

There is nothing so terrifying as a zealot.
The Syndicate is cruel because they
believe themselves to be in the right
and any who oppose them to be wrong.
Then I'm sorry, but I can't stand back and\nwatch this for one second longer!
Kid may not be smart, but at least he lets\nme kick all the butt I want!
You people lack the resolve to know the\nSyndicate's vision of an ideal world,\nand you will all be made examples of.
I won't let you hurt these people!
Time to taste your own wyrmbinding\npower, bucko!

You are both the basest of failures, and we
shall teach you that wyrmbinding is a force
which belongs to the Syndicate alone.
...Come forth, Barbatos B-Unit!
Tch. A sham copy of me. That means\nthey're gonna—
By the Goddess... How did they manage\nto create so many wyrmbound?!
Now, you reject, we'll teach you what a\ntrue wyrmbound can do!
